content:
- go to TB menu > View > Layout > check 'Message List Header' if not already checked

- click the Message list display options icon to the right of the Quick Filter button

- choose Cards View or Table View

- go to TB menu > View > Layout > choose your view

content: Sounds like your antivirus (not MWB) is intercepting the real cert. Which AV are you using?
creator: siffemoz

content:
Have you contacted you email provider (the company that have their name in your email address after the @)

Thunderbird does not and can not bounce emails. I think there might be an addon that some folk install to allow them to pretend their server bounced the email. But a check of the headers makes the add-ons ruse obvious. So if your emails are truly being bounced it will be an issue with the server. Quite possibly your account is full. It is something that can come to bite folk that use IMAP accounts as all the mail stays on the server until you delete it and in some cases also empty the trash. While some providers allow for terabytes to be used storing your mail, internet service providers rarely are very generousness with their storage space of email. So the space fills quite quickly.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: What version of TB are you using? That bug was fixed in v140.
creator: siffemoz

content: The bug was not due to anything FF-related; Mcafee antivirus appears to be the cause. If you're using that, you'll have to disable live scanning.
creator: siffemoz

content:
What exactly have you connected to Strato, is it email domain of hosted wordpress? What domain is the email on? is The DNS for the domain setup for email with an MX record and DKIM, SPF etc. Has it had time to propagate? new domains are far from instantaneous.

Most of the folk I have seen here over the years making noises like you are have signed up for something other that a full hosting deal, or have not configured DNS for the domains email.

I am not even going to try and answer you questions because I am over guessing without relevant information, but you might want to disable the experimental new account hub in settings and see if that has an impact. Search experimental in settings to find it.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
I use a WebPack Basic from Strato and use it to send regular emails to my transferred domains. Strato's webmail works perfectly.

I've now manually edited an old email in Thunderbird (formerly Host Europe). As of now: It seems to be receiving emails. I still need to check the sending configuration.

But that can't be the solution. I actually wanted to keep the old accounts as a backup. It's been about 16 hours since I set them up.

As a test, I set up a new gmx account, which seems to be working without any problems.
